canvases.label: The Psalms of David in the Amharic Language, Inside front cover & f.fl.1r

metadata.value: The Psalms of David in the Amharic Language
metadata.label: Title

metadata.value: View of inside front cover from the Psalms of David in the Amharic language. Inscription (obscured at top) reads: 'From King Theodore's Library at Magdala. Presented by Dr Currie, Inspector General of Hospitals and Principle Medical Officer of the Abyssinian Expedition, to Professor Christison, Edinburgh'. Acquired by Edinburgh University from Medical Professor Robert Christison on November 27th 1869, this edition of the Psalms of David originates from the library of King Theodore of Magdala, Ethiopia and was brought to the UK by Dr Currie, Inspector General of Hospitals and Principle Medical Officer of the Abyssinian Expedition, following the successful conclusion of the campaign at the Battle of Magdala in 1868. It was subsequently presented to Professor Christison in the July 1869, before being gifted to Edinburgh University library.
metadata.label: Description

Presented by Dr Currie, Inspector General of Hospitals and Principle Medical Officer of the Abyssinian Expedition, to Professor Christison, Edinburgh'. Manuscript was presented by Christison to the Library, November 27th 1869. Acquired by Edinburgh University from Medical Professor Robert Christison on November 27th 1869, this edition of the Psalms of David originates from the library of King Theodore of Magdala, Ethiopia and was brought to the UK by Dr Currie, Inspector General of Hospitals and Principle Medical Officer of the Abyssinian Expedition, following the successful conclusion of the campaign at the Battle of Magdala in 1868. It was subsequently presented to Professor Christison in the July 1869, before being gifted to Edinburgh University library.
